Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the class I bacteriocin
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Comments: The Clustal W alignment of the N terminus of sonorensin revealed homology with the leader sequences of protoxins from various Bacillus strains. This indicated that sonorensin, produced initially as a protoxin, was posttransitionally modified to active bacteriocin. The purified sonorensin was also found to be heat stable, stable at low temperature, biologically active over a wide pH range, and not affected in the presence of organic solvents, surfactants, and reducing agents. However, sonoresin was protease-sensitive.

Literature.Title: Sonorensin an antimicrobial peptide, belonging to the heterocycloanthracin subfamily of bacteriocins, from a new marine isolate, Bacillus sonorensis MT93.
Literature.Author: Chopra L, Singh G, Choudhary V, Sahoo DK.
